    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(ServiceContext ctx)
        Description copied from interface: AggregationWorker
        set-up shop and get ready to start aggregation process. Utility for a class to reset in case it is re-used across aggregation cycles. Implementations should put safety against init() when accumulation is in progress. Best practice would be a reset() and then init()
        Specified by:
        init in interface AggregationWorker
        Parameters:
        ctx - service context

      • accumulate

        public void accumulate(FieldsInterface currentRow,
                       ServiceContext ctx)
        Description copied from interface: AggregationWorker
        called with fields from the current row of data. Main method for keep accumulating data
        Specified by:
        accumulate in interface AggregationWorker
        Parameters:
        currentRow - fields from current row being aggregated
        ctx - service context

      • writeOut

        public void writeOut(FieldsInterface outputRow,
                     ServiceContext ctx)
        Description copied from interface: AggregationWorker
        end of rows for the current accumulation. Write-out your result, and get ready for the next accumulation. Note that init is NOT called after this. Also, this is called when there are no more rows
        Specified by:
        writeOut in interface AggregationWorker
        Parameters:
        outputRow - Output Row
        ctx - Service Context

      • reset

        Description copied from interface: AggregationWorker
        reset to a state as if this was never called earlier..
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Description copied from interface: AggregationWorker
        invoked in case the accumulated value is to be discarded (opposite of writeOut)
